Issues.Title: Default XS break point has higher order than other break points !
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

    "tailwindcss": "^3.2.7",

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

 "vite": "^4.1.0",

default XS break point has higher order than others , for example when i use class like this : 'xs:w-1/2 sm:w-1/3 md:w-1/4' w-1/2 come for all break points then we must use it with important label like this  'xs:w-1/2 sm:!w-1/3 md:!w-1/4 '
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Default XS break point has higher order than other break points !" (#11619)

Issues.Title: [WIP]: Refactor and improve tests
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[WIP]: Refactor and improve tests" (#11618)

Issues.Title: Drop shadow not working
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Remix v1.18.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/j18fc6gFQJ

**Describe your issue**

The `drop-shadow` utility class is not working correctly. 

It's producing this class:
```css
.drop-shadow-2xl {
  --tw-drop-shadow: drop-shadow(0 25px 25px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.15));
  filter: var(--tw-blur) var(--tw-brightness) var(--tw-contrast) var(--tw-grayscale) var(--tw-hue-rotate) var(--tw-invert) var(--tw-saturate) var(--tw-sepia) var(--tw-drop-shadow);
}
```

When it should be the one below (according to the docs):
```css
filter: drop-shadow(0 25px 25px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.15));
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Drop shadow not working" (#11612)

Issues.Title: CDN throw error "No utility classes were detected in your source files."
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** CDN - https://cdn.tailwindcss.com **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Nuxt 2.17.0 **What version of Node.js are you using?** V16.16 **What browser are you using?** Chrome / Arc **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** https://stackblitz.com/edit/nuxt-starter-drwk2h?file=nuxt.config.js **Describe your issue** Using the Tailwind through the CDN throws this warning "warn - No utility classes were detected in your source files. If this is unexpected, double-check the `content` option in your Tailwind CSS configuration." The config was set as it's documented. Warning sometimes disappears to repro, refresh the page a couple of times until it shows up Tailwind config and CDN
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CDN throw error "No utility classes were detected in your source files."" (#11608)

Issues.Title: Set `ring-offset-color` fallback in `bg-`
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Playground

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

None

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Linux

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/nVZFBrx4b5?file=css

**Describe your issue**

When adding `ring-offset-2` the `ring-offset-color` defaults to `#fff` even tho it could default to the background color.

**Important to keep in mind**

The fallback needs to be overridable by `ring-offset-color-different`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Set `ring-offset-color` fallback in `bg-`" (#11606)

3.25.2

Issues.Title: appearance-none does not remove basic arrow from select - Tailwind CSS : v3.2.2 - Standalone CLI
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Tailwind CSS : v3.2.2 - Standalone CLI

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Standalone CLI build using the watcher
`./tailwindcss -i input.css -o output.css --watch
`

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

N/A

**What browser are you using?**

Browser : Tested on Firefox and Chrome (same result on both)

**What operating system are you using?**

Browser on Windows
App on WSL2 Linux Ubuntu

**Reproduction URL**

Reproduction: https://play.tailwindcss.com/u66vWQGziq?size=540x720
The bug does not occure on tailwind playground but the setup and code are exactly the same as my app.

**Describe your issue**

Using `appearance-none` in the `select ` class  does not remove the base arrow of the select. Other strange phenomena : using `bg-none` remove the arrow with or without `appearance-none`. Since the same code works fine in the playground this might be an issue with the standalone CLI ?

Result on my app: 
With `appearance-none` and `bg-white` :
![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/64977087/b1d91653-7647-4bf5-92ee-5687d41fa0fd)
Without `appearance-none` and with `bg-none` :
![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/64977087/bcbf3214-4e25-4ed0-81a1-b8ab9ad1c403)


input.css
```
@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Caveat:wght@700&display=swap');
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "appearance-none does not remove basic arrow from select - Tailwind CSS : v3.2.2 - Standalone CLI" (#11601)

Issues.Title: [Nuxt 3] Custom colors don't change once set
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/11557
Originally posted by **CJ-Uy-EVC** July 6, 2023 I am currently working on a nuxt 3 project. After setting my custom colors the first time it no longer changes even when the value in the tailwind.config.js is changed. I've already tried deleting the `.nuxt` folder and running `npx nuxi cleanup` yet when restarting the page it still does not change anything. To add to the confusion going to the `Tailwind Viewer: http://localhost:3000/_tailwind/ ` shows that the NEW correct custom colors not the previous ones being shown in the available colors section. I'm really not quite sure how to fix this issue. Thank you for your time and help in advance! tailwind.config.js ``` import FormKitVariants from "@formkit/themes/tailwindcss"; module.exports = { content: [ "./components/**/*.{js,vue,ts}", "./layouts/**/*.vue", "./pages/**/*.vue", "./plugins/**/*.{js,ts}", "./nuxt.config.{js,ts}", "./app.vue", "./src/**/*.{html,js,vue}", "./node_modules/@formkit/themes/dist/tailwindcss/genesis/index.cjs", ], theme: { extend: { screens: { xs: "614px", sm: "1002px", md: "1022px", lg: "1092px", xl: "1280px", }, colors: { primary: "#0083f7", secondary: "#22397d", offWhite: "#f8f9fe", important: "#d93558", clearGreen: "#5cb388", }, }, }, plugins: [FormKitVariants], }; ``` On my component: ``` ``` I also found that if you do `class = "hover:bg-primary"` it uses the currently place correct color not the previous one
I've tried deleting the node_modules folder and clearing cache to no avail. WEIRDER YET, I've tried to delete the github folder and reclonning the whole repository yet it was still the same.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Nuxt 3] Custom colors don't change once set" (#11573)

Issues.Title: Problem with the default tw-backdrop-brightness property
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Version: "tailwindcss": "^3.3.2",

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

"next": "^13.4.7",
"turbo": "^1.10.6"

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.14.2

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome 114.0.5735.198
In Firefox and other browser everything is fine.

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

Can't provide.

**Describe your issue**

Hello everyone, I'm facing an issue, as you can see in the GIF.
![Jul-12-2023 22-06-25](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/108669343/9aa796fc-16bb-4eaa-8b00-893ee89b9fb8)

My stack includes NextJS, Tailwind, Turborepo, and pnpm.
In Chrome, I noticed that the tw-backdrop-brightness property is being generated, and it's causing display issues.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Problem with the default tw-backdrop-brightness property" (#11598)

Issues.Title: TailwindCSS drop-shadow property creates a new stacking context and overlaps elements with a z-index
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.3.2 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Nuxt 3 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v18.16.0 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** Windows with WSL2 **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/B0c0nVZYRA **Describe your issue** The drop-shadow TailwindCSS class creates a new [stacking context](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_positioned_layout/Understanding_z-index/Stacking_context) because of the usage of filter(). In my project I have a card component with a drop-shadow. In this card component I have dropdown components and when they open another card component directly below them overlaps the dropdown menu.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "TailwindCSS drop-shadow property creates a new stacking context and overlaps elements with a z-index" (#11599)

Issues.Title: Gradient stop as CSS variable in combination with opacity not working
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

SvelteKit

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**
https://play.tailwindcss.com/IK7Xbw0Fhw

**Describe your issue**

When using custom variable with opacity it defaults to:
`--tw-gradient-to: rgb(255 255 255 / 0) var(--tw-gradient-to-position);`

Brief example:
`--color: #7204C9;`

`to-red-500/50` ‚Äî> working
`to-[#7204C9]/50` ‚Äî> working
`to-[var(--color)]` ‚Äî> working
`to-[var(--color)]/50` ‚Äî> Not working
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Gradient stop as CSS variable in combination with opacity not working" (#11593)

Issues.Title: Update sass 1.63.4 ‚Üí 1.63.6 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è sass (1.63.4 ‚Üí 1.63.6) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.63.6

To install Sass 1.63.6, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

JavaScript API

  • Fix import sass from 'sass' again after it was broken in the last release.

Embedded Sass

  • Fix the exports declaration in package.json.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

1.63.5

To install Sass 1.63.5, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

JavaScript API

  • Fix a bug where loading the package through both CJS require() and ESM import could crash on Node.js.

Embedded Sass

  • Fix a deadlock when running at high concurrency on 32-bit systems.

  • Fix a race condition where the embedded compiler could deadlock or crash if a compilation ID was reused immediately after the compilation completed.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 8 commits:

  • Cut a release (#2025)
  • Use the new import name for the ESM default export (#2026)
  • Fix a race condition with re-used compilation isolate IDs (#2018)
  • Update README: npm package does not support --embedded flag (#2022)
  • Add a changelog entry for google/dart_cli_pkg#132 (#2020)
  • Bump protobuf and protoc_plugin (#2021)
  • Update README: install with brew on macOS or Linux (#2012)
  • Limit pool size (#2019)

Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è @‚Äãswc/core (1.3.62 ‚Üí 1.3.68) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/swc-project/swc) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/swc-project/swc/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.3.68 (from changelog)

1.3.67 (from changelog)

1.3.66 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es) Accept parse option for minify() (#7543) (1d84e95)

  • (es/compat) Visit arrow body from optional chaining pass (#7549) (bc6e950)

  • (es/preset-env) Don't log Yield to the console (#7548) (8cfc4f9)

  • (es/resolver) Resolve the super class before registering a class name (#7550) (1d9f972)

Features

  • (es/codegen) Support preamble (#7551) (6e5d8b3)

Testing

  • (es) Add a test for a wrong issue (#7542) (70bc605)

  • (es) Add one more test for a wrong issue (#7545) (862f095)

  • (plugin/runner) Share target directory (#7544) (aa82e5f)

1.3.65 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/compat) Fix optional chaining (#7530) (990e48e)

  • (es/module) Add "use strict" while preserving directives (#7537) (f42fdd2)

  • (es/typescript) Don't panic of @jsxFrag null (#7540) (76aa91f)

Features

  • (es/module) Preserve custom use directives (#7528) (3e9dd88)

1.3.64 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/codegen) Emit type arguments of jsx element names (#7522) (a0da02d)

  • (es/codegen) Fix regression of source maps (#7523) (f27838d)

  • (es/compat) Fix handling of this of optional chaining pass (#7527) (4644d00)

1.3.63 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/codegen) Remove extra spaces in AssignPatProp and KeyValuePatProp (#7488) (064bcf4)

  • (es/compat) Make stage 3 decorator pass use correct state for inner classes (#7508) (cc4146c)

  • (es/minifier) Infect mutation when assigning a property (#7503) (7f9f0b8)

  • (es/react) Default to empty string when emitting refresh signature (#7514) (8e933c8)

Features

  • (es/codegen) Add ability to set indentation string via rust api (#7494) (a343e7c)

  • (es/minifier) Remove unused labels (#7478) (62075fa)

  • (es/parser) Disallow tagged tpl in optional chaining (#7515) (6c00a24)

  • (plugin/runner) Support shared wasix runtime (#7504) (73929fc)

Performance

  • (css/prefixer) Convert macro to a function call to reduce binary size (#7507) (d545df6)

  • (es) Use &dyn Comments to reduce binary size (#7489) (2c3ac68)

  • (es) Use &dyn Comments for jsx and TypeScript (#7490) (abd62bc)

Refactor

  • (es/ast) Reimplement optional chaining (#7441) (aa83584)

  • (es/ast) Remove unused fields (#7518) (3958f17)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by more commits than we can show here.

Issues.Title: Tailwind CSS IntelliSense v0.8.7 works, but versions above are non-functional
Issues.Body:
**What version of VS Code are you using?**

**_Version: 1.79.2_**

**What version of Tailwind CSS IntelliSense are you using?**

**_Only works in v0.8.7_**

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

**_"tailwindcss": "^3.3.2"_**

**What package manager are you using?**

**_npm_**

**What operating system are you using?**

**_Windows_**

**Tailwind config**

```js
module.exports = {
  purge: ['./src/**/*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx}', './public/index.html'],
  darkMode: false, // or 'media' or 'class'
  theme: {
    extend: {},
  },
  variants: {
    extend: {},
  },
  plugins: [],
}

```

**VS Code settings**

```json
"tailwindCSS.includeLanguages": {
        "html": "html",
        "javascript": "javascript",
        "css": "css",
        "plaintext": "jsx"
    },
    "tailwindCSS.experimental.classRegex": [
        "class:\\s*\"([^\"]*)\""
    ],
    "tailwindCSS.emmetCompletions": true,
    "auto-rename-tag.activationOnLanguage": [
        "*"
    ],
```

**Describe your issue**

**_Versions of Tailwind CSS IntelliSense starting from v0.9.0 and above are no longer functioning; only the v0.8.7 and below are operational._**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind CSS IntelliSense v0.8.7 works, but versions above are non-functional" (#11586)

Issues.Title: A array map displays the rank data, starting from the third item, the dynamic w- attribute is not added to the div
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** "tailwindcss": "^3.3.2", **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** "next": "^13.4.8", **What version of Node.js are you using?** v18.13.0 **What browser are you using?** Edge **What operating system are you using?** Win11 **Reproduction URL** A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways. A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue ‚Äî any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves. **Describe your issue** Array map displays the rank data, starting from the second item, the dynamic w- attribute is not added to the div. The demo data: ` export const RankData = [ { rank: 'NO.1', name: 'ÊµéÂçóÂ∏Ç', value: 90 }, { rank: 'NO.2', name: 'ÈùíÂ≤õÂ∏Ç', value: 80 }, { rank: 'NO.3', name: 'ÁÉüÂè∞Â∏Ç', value: 70 }, { rank: 'NO.4', name: 'ÊΩçÂùäÂ∏Ç', value: 60 }, { rank: 'NO.5', name: '‰∏¥Ê≤ÇÂ∏Ç', value: 50 }, { rank: 'NO.6', name: 'ÊµéÂÆÅÂ∏Ç', value: 40 }, { rank: 'NO.7', name: 'Ê∑ÑÂçöÂ∏Ç', value: 30 }, { rank: 'NO.8', name: 'ËèèÊ≥ΩÂ∏Ç', value: 20 }, { rank: 'NO.9', name: 'Âæ∑Â∑ûÂ∏Ç', value: 10 }, { rank: 'NO.10', name: '‰∏úËê•Â∏Ç', value: 5 }, ] ` And the component code : ``` import React from 'react' import {RankData} from "@/constants/data"; type RankItemType = { rank: string, name: string, value: number } const RankItem = (item: RankItemType) => (
{item.rank}
{item.name}
 
{/*
 
*/}
) const ActivityRank = () => { return (
{RankData.map((item, index) => )}
) } export default ActivityRank ``` And the first and the second div add the width property: .w-\[90px\] { width: 80px; } The third div don't have the width property at all. I don't know why, thanks a lot.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "A array map displays the rank data, starting from the third item, the dynamic w- attribute is not added to the div" (#11566)

Issues.Title: Unable to Import Component Files After @tailwind Declaration
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
^3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
- postcss-import ^15.1.0
- vue ^3.3.4
- @vitejs/plugin-vue ^4.2.3
- autoprefixer ^10.4.14
- postcss ^8.4.25
- tailwindcss ^3.3.2
- vite ^4.4.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v19.6.0

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS

**Reproduction URL**
https://github.com/rizkimuhammada/rep

**Describe your issue**
I followed the step-by-step guide provided in the [Tailwind CSS documentation](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/vite#vue) to set up Tailwind CSS with Vite and Vue. However, I encountered an issue while trying to import my component files after the @tailwind declaration.

To reproduce the issue, I followed these steps:

- Installed the "postcss-import" package using the command `npm install postcss-import`.
- Created a main file to import my component files, following the example given in the [Tailwind CSS documentation](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/using-with-preprocessors#build-time-imports).

Expected behavior: I expected to be able to import my component files successfully after the @tailwind declaration.

Actual behavior: Despite following the documentation example precisely, I found that the imports after the @tailwind declaration were not working as expected. I am unable to import my component files.

`12:05:55‚ÄØAM [vite] Internal server error: [postcss] postcss-import: /Users/muhammadrizkia/Desktop/Projects/my-project/src/custom-components.css:1:1: `@layer components` is used but no matching `@tailwind components` directive is present.`

Please note that I have a basic understanding of Vue, Tailwind CSS, and using the command line interface. I believe this issue may be related to the order of imports or the configuration setup.

I would appreciate any guidance or assistance to resolve this issue. Let me know if you need any additional information.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to Import Component Files After @tailwind Declaration" (#11560)

Issues.Title: Variables are sometimes used in tailwind and sometimes not.
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v.3.2.7 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** "webpack-cli": "^5.0.1", "webpack-dev-server": "^4.12.0", "workbox-webpack-plugin": "^6.5.4" "react": "^18.2.0", "react-dom": "^18.2.0", "react-router-dom": "^6.9.0", **What version of Node.js are you using?** v16.15.1 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** Windows10 **Describe your issue** Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead. ```javascript import React, { useState } from "react"; import { TableHeader } from "../commons/TableHeader"; import { TableCell } from "../commons/TableCell"; export const Table = () => { const [name, setName] = useState(""); const [file, setFile] = useState(""); const [state, setState] = useState(""); const [content, setContent] = useState(""); const [textareaList, setTextareaList] = useState([ "", "", "", "", "", "", "", ]); const [colNum, setColNum] = useState(0); const checkingGridcols = () => { if (colNum < 10) { const gridcols = [ "grid-cols-1", "grid-cols-2", "grid-cols-3", "grid-cols-4", "grid-cols-5", "grid-cols-6", "grid-cols-7", "grid-cols-8", "grid-cols-9", "grid-cols-10", "grid-cols-11", "grid-cols-12", ]; return gridcols[colNum]; } else { alert("Don't increasing."); return "grid-cols-10"; } }; const testGridcols = () => { const gridcols = `grid-cols-${colNum}`; return gridcols; }; const gridcols = `grid-cols-${colNum}`; const addTextarea = () => { setTextareaList([...textareaList, ...Array(colNum).fill("")]); // console.log(textareaList); }; const addTextCol = () => { setColNum(colNum + 1); // let addTextareaList: string[] = []; // textareaList.map((row, index) => { // if ((index + 1) % colNum === 0) { // addTextareaList.push(row, ""); // } else { // addTextareaList.push(row); // } // }); // // console.log(addTextareaList); console.log(colNum); // setTextareaList(addTextareaList); }; return (
{/*
*/} {textareaList.map((textarea, index) => ( //
{index}
))}
); }; ``` I want to change `grid-cols-${variable}`. variable is useState. But that's not working except function checkingGridcols in react. I tried to replace the variables by putting them into tailwind, but that's not the way tailwind works, so I thought I'd pre-create them as strings. const testGridcols = () => { const gridcols = `grid-cols-${colNum}`; return gridcols; }; const gridcols = `grid-cols-${colNum}`; I've tried making them both functions and variables, but sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't, so I'm confused. What should I do?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Variables are sometimes used in tailwind and sometimes not." (#11556)

To avoid style conflicts, I added the configuration prefix: "t-" in tailwind.config.js . But when I dynamically set the dark style class, the ‚Äùdark:‚Äú condition has no effect on styles. `document.documentElement.classList.add("dark");` `test`

Issues.Title: Breakpoints not working on production (NextJS/Vercel)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Tailwindcss v3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

NextJS v13.1.6

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

Node v18 LTS

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Zorin (Ubuntu/Linux)

**Reproduction URL**

https://nexo-front-355qt1rau-nexo-team.vercel.app

**Describe your issue**

- The breakpoint style its applied only after i change the screen (like its applied with JS)

- When i change the screen, the breakpoint style is applied at the bottom of the browser element styles list
 
## Screen with 767px
- Only 3 styles
- Display must be: hidden

- Display is: hidden
![Captura de tela de 2023-07-05 17-52-34](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/61320909/948ffbe8-efd4-478b-a177-affd59a51b47)

## Screen with 769px (md breakpoint)
- 4 styles (now the breakpoint style is applied on the bottom os the styles list)
- Display must be: flex
- Display is: hidden (display hidden stay on top of the breakpoint style)
![Captura de tela de 2023-07-05 17-53-09](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/61320909/4fc8e5a8-9d81-4361-8f02-edc57f9cb664)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Breakpoints not working on production (NextJS/Vercel)" (#11552)

Issues.Title: Make PostCSS plugin async to improve performance
Issues.Body:
This PR improves the performance by making the main plugin async. This means that we can replace a bunch of `fs.readFileSync` calls for each template file with a `Promise.all(f => fs.promises.readFile(f))` instead, without blocking IO.

<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Make PostCSS plugin async to improve performance" (#11548)

Issues.Title: [postcss] Cannot create property tailwind.config.js on string node-jiti (File: index.css)
Issues.Body:
**Tailwind**: v3.3.2
**Vite**: v4.3.9
**React**: v18.2.0
**Node**: v19.0.0
**Browser**: Chrome
**OS**: Windows
**pnpm**: V8.6.5
**Reproduction URL**: https://github.com/talkohavy/vite-tailwind-bug

## **Describing the issue**
All I did was simply create a new vite project, with react, and follow your documentation on how to add tailwind.
The steps being:
1. npm create vite@latest my-project -- --template react
2. cd my-project
3. code .
4. pnpm add -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer
5. npx tailwindcss init -p
6. add content to tailwind.config.js:
  content: [
    "./index.html",
    "./src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}",
  ],
7. add to index.css these lines:
   @tailwind base;
   @tailwind components;
   @tailwind utilities;
8. run the command: npm run dev

After doing all that, when I run the start script of `npm run dev`, I open up the brower to see the app,
and get this error:

[plugin:vite:css] [postcss] **Cannot create property** '*******\my-project\tailwind.config.js' on string '*****/AppData/Local/Temp/node-jiti'

![1](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/51020442/d006d1f5-ec6b-4bb0-9c03-19e652991f17)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[postcss] Cannot create property tailwind.config.js on string node-jiti (File: index.css)" (#11546)

Issues.Title: Bump `jiti`, `lightningcss`, `fast-glob` and `browserlist` dependencies and reflect `lightningcss` related improvements in tests
Issues.Body:
This PR bumps some dependencies.

Started from #11546, it looks like jiti broke something, but a version bump fixes this. We already use a range in the version should we don't need to bump it but it doesn't hurt to make the versions up-to-date in the package.json.

This PR also updates some of the tests as a side effect of improvements in the `lightningcss` library.

Fixes #11546
<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Bump `jiti`, `lightningcss`, `fast-glob` and `browserlist` dependencies and reflect `lightningcss` related improvements in tests" (#11550)

Issues.Title: className="grid grid-cols-4"
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

For example: React 18.2.0, vite 4.3.9

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v18.16.0

**What browser are you using?**

For example: Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

For example: Windows

**Reproduction URL**

none

**Describe your issue**
"When I was using the React.js framework and tailwindcss, I found a bug. If I write the code as className='grid grid-cols-4', 'grid' will not be compiled into 'display=grid'. However, if I write the code as className='grid-cols-4 grid', it will be compiled correctly." 
Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "className="grid grid-cols-4"" (#11549)
